results.title: Home page - The California FAIR Plan
results.description: The FAIR Plan was established so that all California property owners have access to basic fire insurance when access to coverage in the traditional market is not available through no fault of the property owner.

cluster.title: About
cluster.description: In the last decade, more Californians have turned to the FAIR Plan as wildfires have devastated California and some insurers have pulled back from these markets. While we will support homeowners regardless of a property’s fire risk, unlike traditional insurers, our goal is attrition.

results.title: California FAIR Plan - Wikipedia
results.description: The California FAIR Plan (California Fair Access to Insurance Requirements) is a fire insurance program created by the state of California that is used by property owners who cannot find private market insurance coverage. The FAIR Plan was established in August 1968 by a statutory amendment ...

results.title: California FAIR Plan Insurance: What You Need to Know

results.title: How to Apply - The California FAIR Plan
results.description: FAIR Plan customer service representatives legally cannot provide you advice on your coverages or limits – a licensed broker can. Insurance agents and brokers may have access to property insurers other than the FAIR Plan. If they cannot find you insurance through another insurance company, they can assist you in applying for a policy through the FAIR Plan.

results.title: Details of The FAIR Plan and Your Financial Plan - Blankinship & Foster, LLC
results.description: For property owners who aren’t able obtain coverage in the traditional insurance market through no fault of their own, the California FAIR Plan has become increasingly important. But what exactly is the CA FAIR Plan, and how might it fit into your overall financial strategy? The CA FAIR (Fair Access to Insurance Requirements) Plan provides basic fire insurance coverage for high-risk properties when private insurers won’t.

results.title: California FAIR Plan continues denying smoke damage claims despite court loss and regulatory action - Los Angeles Times
results.description: The smoke damage policy has been controversial for years and sparked multiple lawsuits, but it wasn’t until June in a case brought by a Northern California homeowner that a judge found the policy violated state law. ... That decision by Los Angeles County Superior Court Judge Stuart Rice found that the FAIR Plan’s requirement that smoke damage result in “permanent physical damage” violated the insurance code because it provides less coverage than what is required by the state’s Standard Form Fire Insurance Policy.

results.title: What is the California Fair Plan?
results.description: The California FAIR Plan, or the Fair Access to Insurance Requirements Plan, is an insurance program established in California to provide essential property insurance coverage to homeowners who are unable to obtain insurance through the regular insurance market.

results.title: Prospective Brokers - The California FAIR Plan
results.description: If you’re a licensed broker or agent and interested in placing business with the FAIR Plan, you’ll need to submit a New Broker Information Form. Be prepared to include a copy of your valid and active California Property-Casualty license.
